post.body: Tune in to KDVS sometime after 10:30, I'll play something Boats 'n' Hoes related.
I'll email you an mp3 later or something.
Mixing business and pleasure in Reno, taking pics for Southwest Airlines and then SEEING GIRL TALK!! Btw, Reno feels like death in the womb.
Oracle sketch on classic SNL hosted by Will Ferrell contains great lines like: "Jeez of Nazareth!" and "Who the hell's duffel bag is this!?"
I CAN'T FART LOUD ENOUGH TO EXPRESS MY OPINION! was a great line. But Wahlberg proved you gotta actually make a fart noise to get the Oscar.
Clint Eastwood may be done for, but I still love his reporter in True Crime. Don't care about Jesus, justice, or right or wrong. Just truth.
As little as I care for college sports, or being in SoMa on the weekend, I'd still like to be at the Emerald Bowl right now. Looks like fun!
For the record, what's sadder on a Friday night than a couple sitting next to each other on the couch arguing and then tweeting the results?
For the record, I hereby do not take movie or any other kind of advice from people that don't love Love Actually as much as I do. Real talk.
Boiler Room: Hustler hat on Affleck. Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels: Hustler sticker in getaway van. Fight Club: Hustler shirt on Pitt.
Woke up sick, so I missed my grandpa's 90th birthday party, but now I'm watchin Fight Club and eating chili cheese burger, so it's all good.
A decade ago, the Lock Stock & Two Smoking Barrels script felt totally fresh and new. Now, it's an average episode of Curb Your Enthusiasm.
I think I like Katie because she says stuff like this all the time: "I met Thomas Kinkade once, and Jared Padalecki looks nothing like him."
Why when you type "Nazi" into Google, the first search suggestion that pops up is "Nazi zombies"? Why not "Nazi mummies" or "Nazi vampires"?
Was trying to find the name of that concentration camp doc I like, and instead stumbled upon the wealth of mythology about a Nazi moon base.
Being in sales and loving the antics in Boiler Room or Wall Street is like being German and loving the antics in Triumph of the Will. Right?
If you like squirrels, Christmas, Screamin' Jay Hawkins and April Fools pranks, please check out the Mission Mission tribute to Eartha Kitt.
Katie's on right now, playing all the best soul ever made -- like she used to at Beauty Bar!! I'll take over in a bit and go until midnight.
I'm going over to Davis right now to be a substitute DJ on KDVS. Should be a train wreck, or very fun. Listen in if you'd like: www.kdvs.org
Can't remember whether it was Mark Twain or Toni Morrison (same dif) that had slaves and black people refer to they "fambly." But I LUH dat.
